lines:
Telegraphic Address:

IMPERIAL, TIENTSIN.

num

930

IN YOUR REPLL

IMPERIAL RAILWAYS OF NORTH CHINA.

Engineer-in-Chies's Office .

REFERENCE

GIVE THIS

PEFERENCE -

TO YOUR

"OUR LETTE

Longshan. 17th. May 1909.

in

A. E. Stearns Esq,

Principal, 
Phillips Academy,

Andover, Mass. U. S. A. 
Dear Sir,

I beg to acknowledge the receipt of your valued favour 
of the 12th April, enclosing a statement of receipts & expenditures 
on Luk shiu Cho's account, with thanks.

I have translated the said account and handed over to 
Mr Luk's parent as it is requested, and the latter desired me to 
tender his thanks to you for your kindness in looking after his 
son's interest and wellfare etc, while staying in U. S.

Mr. Tong Kaisun has now returned to Peking and Mr Luk's 
father has asked Mr Tong to arrange to send you further remittance 
in a few days. 
Again thanking you for your kind favour,

I remain,

Yours very truly.

JA J. Luk

S.  Mr. Tong Kaisun has now returned to Peking and Mr Luk's  father has asked Mr Tong to arrange to send you further remittance  in a few days.  Again thanking you for your kind favour,  I remain,  Yours very truly.  JA J. Luk

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter thanking Stearns for the statement of account for S.C. Luk. He has translated the document for Luk's parent, who also thanks Stearns for his kindness to his son. Mr. Ton Kaison has returned to Peking and he will send remittance in a few days, as requested by Luk's father.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
